Posts.Content: Jun 1, 2013 11:25AM sharon1953- wrote: I have had my tissue expanders in for about 3 wks. and I notice if I use my arms at all, the muscle gets very tight.  Will putting heat on the muscle help it relax?  I find that at the end of the day is when it gets bad.  I also found out that I will be getting chemo and rads, so I know I will have the expanders in for a while.  Also, I was told that they have to expand the tissue more because it will could shrink during radiation.  Has anyone had this issue???

Posts.Content: Jun 6, 2013 06:44AM sharon1953- wrote: I am a newbie.  I had a bilateral mas 3  wks. ago.  I also had 18 positive nodes.  I never dreamed that I would have that many, either did my surgeon.  My concern is that maybe I should have had chemo before my surgery, and maybe would not have had so many nodes.  I will be starting chemo is about 2 wks.  I am so glad to have this site to go to for support.  I have been on here since I was diagnosed.  When i get to feeling low, I will read the many wonderful stories and feel that I to can make it.  Trying to stay positive, but sometimes it is really hard!!! I have a wonderful support group(family and friends, but sometimes it is better to hear from people who have been through this difficult journey.  Thanks so all the wonderful tips and support!!!!
Posts.Title: A place to greet and meet newbies to stage III hopefour Castigame

Posts.Content: Apr 13, 2013 05:25PM sharon1953- wrote: I am having a bilateral mastectomy April 22.  I will have the tissue expander.  Never thought I would be so glad to have surgery.  I only have bc on the left side, but since I have dense breast and the mammogram did not detect it, I decided that I did not want to risk it.  I know I will get through it with the help of my family, friends, and most of all GOD.  Any suggestions/tips on the first few wks. of recovery would be greatly appreciated!!!
Posts.Title: April 2013 Mastectomy ldesim ashleigh

Posts.Content: Apr 6, 2013 03:37PM sharon1953- wrote: I agree that waiting for results is the worst part of this process so far.  I had a biospy and was given an appt. to come in for the results 2 days later.  They will not do it over the phone.
Posts.Title: This is torture SonjaJ sharon1953-

Posts.Content: Apr 27, 2013 02:07PM sharon1953- wrote: Well, things have changed quite a bit since I was diagnosed in March.  I was scheduled for surgery on April 22, but it was canceled a few days before surgery because my surgeon was concerned about by chest CT scan.  I have had many tests :  breast mri, bone scan, CT scan, and just recently a bronchscopy.  On my chest CT, they saw some very small nodules that they were concerned about. My surgeon would not do the surgery until he was sure the cancer was not somwhere else.  Is there another test that I should have?  I am at the point of wanting chemo first instead of surgery.  That way if there is cancer floating around the chemo will kill it.  I have noticed that lots of people have chemo before surgery.  What are the reasons for that?  I am very anxious to get started with something!!!  I am amost at the point of wanting a second opinion!!!!!!
Posts.Title: This is torture SonjaJ sharon1953-

Posts.Content: Apr 6, 2013 03:50PM sharon1953- wrote: I was diagnosed on March 13 with IDC.  I have met with my surgeon and will meet with a plastic surgeon this Thurs.  I just want to get on with either treament or surgery.  The surgeon told me I would need a mastectomy becasue of the location of the mass.  It is right above the nipple.  He felt it would not be able to get a clean margin.  My mass is about 2.5cm.  I feel that is large!!! Has anyone had one that large or larger???  What tests do most dr. ask for before surgery?  I've had an mri, and will be going for a bone scan on mon.  That concerns be. I still don't know what treatment or when the surgery will be!!! The waiting is horrible!!!!
Posts.Title: This is torture SonjaJ sharon1953-

Posts.Content: May 18, 2013 02:09PM sharon1953 wrote: I had a lumpectomy on March 21 (no node involvement) but did not get clear margins.  On March 28th they went in for a second time.  They thought they had clear margins but the pathologist looked at it again and said a tip was out of the margin.  The doctor suggested chemo, rad, and a estrogen blocking pill.  I chose to not have chemo.  I am in the middle of radiation right now.  So far no SE's except tired in the afternoon. I am taking a exercise class before I go to rad's...this has helped me emotionally a whole bunch.  I put a cream on my breast that the doctor gave me as soon as I come out of radiation each day.  When I get home, I slather aloe vera on my breast ( my plant looks awful - haha)...so far I have not had the redness etc.
